page.title: 13OLDHAM'S FAMOUS MARKET
page.content: {THE OPEN MARKET.}IT IS OVER 100 YEARS SINCE A MARKET STARTED IN OLDHAM.NOW IT IS PART OF OLDHAM LIFE.IT IS CALLED THE TOMMY-FIELD AFTER THOMAS WHITTAKER WHO OWNED THE MEADOW ORIGINALLY.WE THINK IT IS THE LARGEST LOCAL AUTHORITY MARKET IN THE COUNTRY.IT HAS 500 STALLS;SOME QUIET SELLING STALLS AND SOME PITCHING STALLS.THE ATMOSPHERE IS NOISY,BUSY AND FRIENDLY.PEOPLE ENJOY SHOPPING THERE. YOU CAN MEET MANY AMUSING CHARACTERS THERE. {THE COVERED MARKET.}THE VICTORIA MARKET HALL (LISTED AS A BUILDING OF HISTORICAL AND ARCHITECTURAL IMPORTANCE) WAS BURNED DOWN IN 1974. THE NEW HALL ISN'T POPULAR.IT COST Â£250,000 AND THE COUNCIL SAID IT WAS TEMPORARY,BUT IT IS STILL THERE.THE STALL-HOLDERS SAY THERE ISN'T ENOUGH ROOM TO DISPLAY GOODS.
